Yes, flight attendants also receive psychological training to help them handle the stress of emergency situations. The training is designed to help them cope with the physical and emotional demands of emergency situations, as well as to help them maintain composure during high-stress situations.

This training typically covers topics such as stress management, mindfulness, teamwork, communication, and coping mechanisms. The goal is to help flight attendants stay focused and calm during emergency situations while also being able to provide the necessary support to passengers.

Airlines also have procedures in place to help flight attendants deal with the emotional aftermath of emergency situations. This can include counseling and debriefing sessions to help them process any traumatic experiences they may have had during the flight.

Overall, airlines take the safety and well-being of their passengers and crew very seriously, and they provide comprehensive training and support to ensure that flight attendants are prepared for any emergency situation that may arise.
